page.title: Apple AirPort Extreme Base Station A1408 (MD031LL/A)

revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = Broadcom BCM94331PCIEDUAL |rad2modif = PCIe (non-standard connector) |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4331; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "APPLE", "820-2622-A", and "(C) 2009" is silkscreened on the mainboard in the FCC photos. :The ''[[Broadcom]]'' logo, "BCM94331PCIEDUAL", and "200-120101-0050 A" :is silkscreened on the wireless module in the FCC photos.
Manufactured by [[Foxconn]] / Hon Hai / [[Ambit]] Microsystems (internal P/N U01H734T01) :MD031AM/A seems to be the model of this device in Canada.
The FCC submitted manual says the default SSID is '''AirPort Network XXXXXX''', :where '''XXXXXX''' is the last three octets of the MAC address.
==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[http://www.anandtech.com/show/4577/airport-extreme-5th-gen-and-time-capsule-4th-gen-review-faster-wifi- On '''AnandTech'''] (teardown and source of much of the data here) *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31564-apple-airport-extreme-gen-5-reviewed Reviewed on '''SmallNetBuilder''']
